verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of Yahweh <WH3068> which came to Jeremiah <WH3414> the prophet <WH5030> concerning the nations. <WH1471>

Of Egypt: <WH4714> concerning the army <WH2428> of Pharaoh Necoh <WH6549> king <WH4428> of Egypt, <WH4714> which was by the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578> in Carchemish, <WH3751> which Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> struck <WH5221> in the fourth <WH7243> year <WH8141> of Jehoiakim <WH3079> the son <WH1121> of Josiah, <WH2977> king <WH4428> of Judah. <WH3063>
Prepare <WH6186> the buckler <WH4043> and shield, <WH6793> and draw near <WH5066> to battle! <WH4421>

Harness <WH631> the horses, <WH5483> and get up, <WH5927> you horsemen, <WH6571> and stand forth <WH3320> with your helmets; <WH3553> furbish <WH4838> the spears, <WH7420> put on <WH3847> the coats of mail. <WH5630>

Why have I seen <WH7200> it? <WH2844> they are dismayed and are turned <WH5472> backward; <WH268> and their mighty ones <WH1368> are beaten down, <WH3807> and have fled <WH5127> apace, <WH4498> and don't <WH6437> look back: terror <WH4032> is on every side, <WH5439> says <WH5002> Yahweh. <WH3068>

Don't <WH7031> let the swift flee away, <WH5127> nor the mighty man <WH1368> escape; <WH4422> in the north <WH6828> by <WH3027> the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578> have they stumbled <WH3782> and fallen. <WH5307>
Who is this who rises up <WH5927> like the Nile, <WH2975> whose waters <WH4325> toss <WH1607> themselves like the rivers? <WH5104>

Egypt <WH4714> rises up <WH5927> like the Nile, <WH2975> and his waters <WH4325> toss <WH1607> themselves like the rivers: <WH5104> and he says, <WH559> I will rise up, <WH5927> I will cover <WH3680> the earth; <WH776> I will destroy <WH6> cities <WH5892> and its inhabitants. <WH3427>

Go up, <WH5927> you horses; <WH5483> and rage, <WH1984> you chariots; <WH7393> and let the mighty men <WH1368> go forth: <WH3318> Cush <WH3568> and Put, <WH6316> who handle <WH8610> the shield; <WH4043> and the Ludim, <WH3866> who handle <WH8610> and bend <WH1869> the bow. <WH7198>

For that day <WH3117> is of the Lord, <WH136> Yahweh <WH136> of Armies, <WH6635> a day <WH3117> of vengeance, <WH5360> that he may avenge <WH5358> him of his adversaries: <WH6862> and the sword <WH2719> shall devour <WH398> and be satiate, <WH7646> and shall drink <WH7301> its fill of their blood; <WH1818> for the Lord, <WH136> Yahweh <WH3069> of Armies, <WH6635> has a sacrifice <WH2077> in the north <WH6828> country <WH776> by the river <WH5104> Euphrates. <WH6578>

Go up <WH5927> into Gilead, <WH1568> and take <WH3947> balm, <WH6875> virgin <WH1330> daughter <WH1323> of Egypt: <WH4714> in vain <WH7723> do you use many <WH7235> medicines; <WH7499> there is no healing for you. <WH8585>

The nations <WH1471> have heard <WH8085> of your shame, <WH7036> and the earth <WH776> is full of your cry; <WH6682> for the mighty <WH1368> man <WH1368> has stumbled <WH3782> against the mighty, <WH1368> they are fallen <WH5307> both <WH8147> of them together. <WH3162>

The word <WH1697> that Yahweh <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> to Jeremiah <WH3414> the prophet, <WH5030> how that Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> should come <WH935> and strike <WH5221> the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>

Declare <WH5046> in Egypt, <WH4714> and publish <WH8085> in Migdol, <WH4024> and publish <WH8085> in Memphis <WH5297> and in Tahpanhes: <WH8471> say, <WH559> Stand forth, <WH3320> and prepare; <WH3559> for the sword <WH2719> has devoured <WH398> around you. <WH5439>
Why are your strong <WH47> ones swept away? <WH5502> they didn't <WH5975> stand, because Yahweh <WH3068> pushed them. <WH1920>

He made many <WH7235> to stumble, <WH3782> yes, <WH5307> they fell one <WH376> on another: <WH7453> and they said, <WH559> Arise, <WH6965> and let us go again <WH7725> to our own people, <WH5971> and to the land <WH776> of our birth, <WH4138> from <WH6440> the oppressing <WH3238> sword. <WH2719>
They cried <WH7121> there, <WH6547> Pharaoh king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> is but a noise; <WH7588> he has let the appointed <WH4150> time pass by. <WH5674>

As I live, <WH2416> says <WH5002> the King, <WH4428> whose name <WH8034> is Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> surely like Tabor <WH8396> among the mountains, <WH2022> and like Carmel <WH3760> by the sea, <WH3220> so shall he come. <WH935>

You daughter <WH1323> who dwells <WH3427> in Egypt, <WH4714> furnish <WH6213> yourself to go into captivity; <WH3627> for Memphis <WH5297> shall become a desolation, <WH8047> and shall be burnt <WH3341> up, <WH3427> without inhabitant.
Egypt <WH4714> is a very beautiful <WH3304> heifer; <WH5697> but destruction <WH7171> out <WH935> of the north <WH6828> has come, <WH935> it has come.

Also her hired men <WH7916> in the midst <WH7130> of her are like calves <WH5695> of the stall; <WH4770> for they also are turned back, <WH6437> they are fled away <WH5127> together, <WH3162> they didn't <WH5975> stand: for the day <WH3117> of their calamity <WH343> has come <WH935> on them, <WH6256> the time of their visitation. <WH6486>

The sound <WH6963> of it shall go <WH3212> like the serpent; <WH5175> for they shall march <WH3212> with an army, <WH2428> and come <WH935> against her with axes, <WH7134> as wood <WH6086> cutters. <WH2404>

They shall cut down <WH3772> her forest, <WH3293> says <WH5002> Yahweh, <WH3068> though it can't <WH2713> be searched; because they are more <WH7231> than the locusts, <WH697> and are innumerable. <WH369>
The daughter <WH1323> of Egypt <WH4714> shall be disappointed; <WH3001> she shall be delivered <WH5414> into the hand <WH3027> of the people <WH5971> of the north. <WH6828>

Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> says: <WH559> Behold, <WH6485> I will punish Amon <WH527> of No, <WH4996> and Pharaoh, <WH6547> and Egypt, <WH4714> with her gods, <WH430> and her kings; <WH4428> even Pharaoh, <WH6547> and those who trust in him: <WH982>

and I will deliver <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of those who seek <WH1245> their lives, <WH5315> and into the hand <WH3027> of Nebuchadnezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon, <WH894> and into the hand <WH3027> of his servants; <WH5650> and afterwards <WH310> it shall be inhabited, <WH7931> as in the days <WH3117> of old, <WH6924> says <WH5002> Yahweh. <WH3068>

But don't <WH3372> you be afraid, Jacob <WH3290> my servant, <WH5650> neither be dismayed, <WH2865> Israel: <WH3478> for, <WH3467> behold, I will save you from afar, <WH7350> and your seed <WH2233> from the land <WH776> of their captivity; <WH7628> and Jacob <WH3290> shall return, <WH7725> and shall be quiet <WH8252> and at ease, <WH7599> and none shall make him afraid. <WH2729>

Don't <WH3372> you be afraid, O Jacob <WH3290> my servant, <WH5650> says <WH5002> Yahweh; <WH3068> for I am with you: <WH6213> for I will make a full end <WH3617> of all the nations <WH1471> where I have driven <WH5080> you; <WH6213> but I will not make a full end <WH3617> of you, <WH3256> but I will correct you in measure, <WH4941> and will in no way <WH5352> leave you unpunished. <WH5352>
